alert.note: Alert for Mineral (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 10:50AM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River near PT Site below Weber Reservoir near Schurz affecting Mineral County. .Snow melt and reservoir releases will cause the river flows to remain high. Moderate flooding downstream from Weber Dam is ongoing. Some low lying and agricultural areas below Weber are flooded, including some rural access roads. There are reports of stranded cattle on higher islands within the river channel. Severe bank erosion is ongoing, with a large amount of debris in the river channel, so use extreme caution along the riverbanks. For the Mainstem Walker River...including PT Site below Weber Reservoir near Schurz...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt and reservoir releases is ongoing. * WHERE...Walker River near PT Site below Weber Reservoir near Schurz. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Moderate flooding below Weber Reservoir impacting agricutural land and access roads. River Bank instablilty may cause additional impacts. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:25 AM PDT Sunday the stage was 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:25 AM PDT Sunday was 19.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood stage is 17.3 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov The next statement will be issued by Monday at 400 PM PDT.
